unit.utterance_translation: there was yam in those days; that was our food;
(That was) our food there in Disubu.

unit.utterance: Saya panga:nènmi ta ayta Disubu aydi:ti.
unit.utterance_translation: These were our food there in Disubu before.

unit.utterance: ngaytid ngaytid mangali tidi inami ta giwat aydi ilus,
unit.utterance_translation: our mothers went to dig root crops.
There was no one who was growing rice.
That is what I looked at concerning our food.

unit.utterance: saya ma:lap didi amamiti a laman.
unit.utterance_translation: Those ones, wild pigs, our fathers were able to get.
That was our viand there in Disubu.
It is Aglipay. (It is) there (along) the big river.

unit.utterance: Aytawadi:ti awantep ta Iloka:no ti ayta.
unit.utterance_translation: At that time before, Ilokano people were not there yet.

unit.utterance: Ta dutul a langit, awantep taya Ilokano.
unit.utterance_translation: Before, there were no Ilokano people yet.

unit.utterance: Me''a:du i i:yan, aydi laman, aydi bidut, aydi: burog.
unit.utterance_translation: There were many fish, wild pigs, deer, and monkeys.

unit.utterance: Atti, atti konta atti: ti ayti Sinabègèn.
unit.utterance_translation: There were (Ilongot people), but they were in Sinabagan.
They could not come there yet
Their place of mountans were different (They used to live near the different mountains).

unit.utterance: Ayti Sinabagan i attanan didi ilongoti.
unit.utterance_translation: The place of the Ilongot people was in Sinabagan.

unit.utterance: Atti ba'it a awan tep maka'angay ta Disubu.
unit.utterance_translation: there is a gap/buffer zone so they could not come to Disubu
because they were afraid (of Arta people).
(which) our fathers were using in those days.

unit.utterance: Saya i pa:ngalapdi ta yakkanmi a laman.
unit.utterance_translation: That is our getting of our food, wild pig.
There was no hearing sound by you.
(because, unlike guns) arrows do not emit sounds.
only (enough) 'chu!' like that. There is no sound of it.
The wild pig dies like this.
They carry it on the shoulder.
(and) we cook [lit. do] it on the fire.

unit.utterance: Manaka:ngamid a mangiyakkan ti ba:lutidi ayde:tidi ilusi,
unit.utterance_translation: We simmer (wild yams?), vianded with [i.e. eaten as a viand with] the yam and purple yam.

unit.utterance: Saya i panga:to:laymi ta dutul a langit ayta Disubu.
unit.utterance_translation: That is our life in those days in Disubu.

unit.utterance: Konta aytay, da inumangayamid ti ayti,
unit.utterance_translation: But now, because we moved here

unit.utterance: Ay ta dutul, awan ta kape.
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, there was no coffee in those days.
Just our (way of) salting was this one.

unit.utterance: Kangpéppéti pakki:bumi. Saya pa:ngasinmi umande:na atti asinna.
unit.utterance_translation: "Kangpeppet" was what we [used to] mix. That is our seasoning, [which is] as if there is salt.
